intro: Tithymalus caudiculosus, commonly known as the slender tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize new areas effectively. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens as an ornamental plant.
